title: 1995 and 1997 Recommendations of Removal Under 8 U.S.C. § 1227(a)(4)(C) (U.S. Department of State)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of the following recommendations referenced in a May 9, 2025, filing by the U.S. Department of Justice in Khalil v. Joyce, et al., Civ. Act. No. 25-1963 (MEF) (MAH) (D.N.J.), available at https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.njd.564334/gov.uscourts.njd.564334.246.0.pdf:

(a) by Secretary of State Warren Christopher to the Attorney General on January 5, 1995, that Mohammad J.A. Khalifah ("Khalifah") be removed under INA § 241(a)(4)(C) (the "Khalifah Recommendation");
(b) by Secretary of State Warren Christopher to the Attorney General on March 29, 1995, that a Haitian national (the "Haitian National") be removed under INA § 241(a)(4)(C) (the "Haitian National Recommendation");
(c) by Secretary of State Warren Christopher to the Attorney General on October 2, 1995, that Mario Ruiz Massieu ("Massieu") be removed under INA § 241 (a)(4)(C) (the "Massieu Recommendation"); and
(d) by Secretary of State Madeleine Albright to the Attorney General on April 4, 1995, that a Palestinian national ("the "Palestinian National") be removed under INA § 241 (a)(4)(C) (the "Palestinian National Recommendation").

2. Any communications between the Department of State, the Department of Justice, and/or the Department of Homeland Security concerning any of:
(a) Khalifah or the Khalifah Recommendation;
(b) the Haitian National or the Haitian National Recommendation;
(c) Massieu or the Massieu Recommendation; or
(d) the Palestinian National or the Palestinian National Recommendation. 

3. Any internal communications, reports, or other records referencing any of:
(a) Khalifah or the Khalifah Recommendation;
(b) the Haitian National or the Haitian National Recommendation;
(c) Massieu or the Massieu Recommendation; or
(d) the Palestinian National or the Palestinian National Recommendation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh
